greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Largest prime factor of Euler totient function phi(n).
comment: Smallest numbers m, such that largest prime factor of phi(m) is prime(n), a(n) is a prime number and identical to the n-th term of A035095: min{x: A068211(x) = prime(n)} = A035095(n). E.g., phi(A035095(7)) = phi(103) = 2*3*17 of which 17 = prime(7) is the largest prime factor.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 3..1000
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Feb 21 2002
